result.execSummary:
The defendant James J. Andraska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Psilocin (>500 g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(g)3.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain FTE, schooling or combination of both.

Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: Imposed and Stayed to be used for rule violations.

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:28 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Peter Rotter. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.
State moves to DRI Ct.3- Maintain Drug Trafficking Place (PTAC) & DRI Ct.4- Manufacture/Deliver Psilocin (PTAC)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Possess w/Intent- Psilocin (PTAC)>>NO CONTEST 
           Ct.2- Possess w/Intent- THC (PTAC)>>NO CONTEST 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. Attorney Rotter notes some family members would like to make statements on behalf of defendant. Relative makes statement. Pastor makes statement. Attorney Rotter notes family members in attendance supporting defendant. State requests 30 days conditional jail time. Attorney Rotter objects. Defendant addresses court. 
COURT ORDERS: Ct.1 & Ct.2-SWH, 3 years probation. CONDITIONS: 60 days MCJ imposed and stayed to be used for rule violations, participate any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, AODA and any follow up, maintain absolute sobriety, obtain/maintain FTE, schooling or a combination of both, CC & DNA sample and surcharge.
